March 10, 1967
Mrs. Edward F. Ryan
110 Bridge Street
Manchester, Massachusetts 01944
Dear Charlotte:
Last October, I represented NCPT at a conference
at Wingspread which was for the purpose of strength¬
ening Educational Radio as a national resource.
I believe educational radio has great educational
potential (see my attached report) and that NCPT could
be of assistance in its development by moral and legis¬
lative support.
Also attached is additional information just received which
will be of interest to you.
Perhaps Dr. Mathewson could be helpful to you by giving
his views on educational radio, should you want further
information.
Anything you can do, Charlotte, as Legislation Chairman
at the national level could be most helpful to the cause of
educational radio.
Convention time is coming up soon and we'll all be in the
thick of things again.
As always,
Milton R. Litterst, Ed.D.
Vice-President, NCPT
MRLrma
Enclosures
